title: The Accident on Channel 4: When is it on and is the plot based on a true story?

The Accident is a thought-provoking drama coming to British screens.

Channel 4 are airing this community-driven drama that focuses on the aftermath of an horrific construction site disaster that kills multiple teens and leaves a town in mourning.

Focusing on multiple residents, but anchored by Sarah Lancashire in the role of a politician's wife, the series examines a town pushed to its limits.

But when can we watch the series and is the tale based on a true story?

Here is what you need to know about The Accident.

The Accident on Channel 4: When is it on?

The Accident starts on Channel 4 tonight - Thursday, October 24 - at 9pm.

(Image: Channel 4/The Forge/Simon Ridgwa)

It is a four-part series and each episode will be available on All 4 once it has aired.

What is the plot?

The official plot synopsis from Channel 4 reads that the series: "is set in the fictional community of Glyngolau – a ‘left behind’ town in Wales. In episode one, an explosion on the construction site of a much-needed and sought-after regeneration project claims the lives of several teenagers who have broken onto the building site to make mischief. As grief gives way to anger the community finds itself forced to confront difficult truths amid the search for justice.

(Image: Channel 4/The Forge/Warren Orcha)

"Polly Bevan (Sarah Lancashire) is the wife of the local politician who championed the project and the person to whom the stricken community turns following the disaster. Her husband, Iwan, (Mark Lewis Jones) loves his home town and is passionate about restoring the town to its former glory, but at what cost?"

There's sure to be some dramatic scenes that unfold.

Is it based on a true story?

(Image: Channel 4/The Forge/Warren Orcha)

Despite being an entirely fictional incident, writer Jack Thorne (Harry Potter and the Cursed Child) has said he was inspired by the tragic circumstances at Grenfell Tower in 2017.

Speaking to Radio Times , Thorne said: "The idea was always to look at class and restorative justice, that that was the sort of thing that we wanted to look at, and I had an idea in my head. And then Grenfell happened, and the idea changed.

"The concept of looking at corporate manslaughter, and the way a corporate manslaughter trial might work came about."

The Accident on Channel 4 cast

Sarah Lancashire as Polly Bevan

The wife of a local politician who championed a disastrous regeneration project.

Joanna Scanlan as Angela Griffiths

One of Polly's oldest friends.

Genevieve Barr as Debbie Kethin

One of Polly's oldest friends.

Sidse Babett Knudsen as Harriet Paulsen

The the executive at Kallbridge Developments who becomes a focus of the town's anger.

Shaun Parkes as Martin Harris

A man injured in the accident.

Adrian Scarborough as Philip Walters

A lawyer with an agenda.

Oliver Ryan as Sergeant Guy Hughes

A town police officer.

Nabhaan Rizwan as Tim

Eiry Thomas as Greta

Another of Polly's close friends.

Mark Lewis Jones as Iwan Bevan

Polly's husband and a local politician.

Jade Croot as Leona Bevan

Polly's daughter and the sole survivor of the accident.

Kimberly Nixon as Detective Hendricks

The Accident starts on Channel 4 tonight at 9pm, with episodes available on All 4 after.
